title: Kylie Jenner cashing in on viral meme with ‘rise and shine’ merch
text:
Kylie is making the most of the viral meme by releasing these hoodies (Picture: kyliejennershop.com)

If there’s one thing the Kardashian-Jenners know how to do, it’s how to turn any situation around in their favour to make money… so of course Kylie Jenner wasn’t going to let ‘rise and shine’ go without cashing in.

The youngest Kardashian sibling went viral this week after a clip of her singing ‘rise and shine’ to her baby daughter Stormi caught the internet’s attention and spawned about a million memes.

As well as laughing at herself by reposting a fan edit of her as the sun from the Teletubbies and a video of Stormi Webster dancing to a remix of her song, Kylie dropped some exclusive ‘rise and shine’ merch.

She revealed a black and a white hoodie, featuring her face in a cartoon sun and the words ‘riiise x shiiinnee’ down the arms.

Advertisement

Advertisement

We’ve never felt the saying ‘the devil works but Kris Jenner works harder’ to be more true than now, because you know Kylie got her business acumen from her momager.

The hoodies come in black and white and feature Kylie’s face on the front (Picture: kyliejennershop.com)

Given how quickly viral trends can die out, we reckon Kylie has about a week and a half to shift all this stock (Picture: kyliejennershop.com)

The hoodies retail for a very tidy $65 (£50.60) on Kylie’s online store, kyliejennershop.com, so she’s definitely going to top up her billionaire bank balance with a pretty penny if she shifts enough of these.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Depending how long the hype carries on for, Kylie could also be launching a singing career as Ariana Grande has already reached out to her to sample the clip in a song.

Ari posted a video of her singing ‘rise and shine’ on her Instagram story asking ‘@kyliejenner can I sample’, to which the make up mogul replied: ‘Yes, yes you can @arianagrande. As long as I’m in music video’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

While we’re pretty sure Ariana was joking (at least we hope so), if there’s cash to be made from a pop track, we’re pretty sure it could happen.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

MORE: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott handling co-parenting ‘really well’ following split
description: Kylie Jenner has released a range of hoodies cashing in on the viral meme of her singing 'rise and shine' to daughter Stormi Webster.
